customClasses.DancingFinch
Class MidiPlayer

java.lang.Object
  


All Implemented Interfaces: 
EventListener, MetaEventListener








public class MidiPlayer
extends Object
implements MetaEventListener

Allows the user to play MIDI files. Taken from http://www.brackeen.com/javagamebook/

Author:
David Brackeen

MidiPlayer

public MidiPlayer()

Method Detail

close

public void close()
Closes the sequencer

getSequence

public Sequence getSequence(String filename)
Loads a sequence from the file system. Returns null if an error occurs

Parameters:
filename - The filename of the MIDI file
Returns:
A Sequence object corresponding to this MIDI file

getSequencer

public Sequencer getSequencer()
Gets the sequencer

Returns:
The Sequencer object

isPaused

public boolean isPaused()
Gets the paused state

Returns:
true if the sequencer is paused, false otherwise

meta

public void meta(MetaMessage event)
This method is called by the sound system when a meta event occurs. In this case, when the end-of-track meta event is received, the sequence is restarted if looping is on.

Specified by:
meta in interface MetaEventListener

play

public void play(Sequence sequence,
                 boolean loop)
Plays a sequence, optionally looping. This method returns immediately. The sequence is not played if it is invalid

Parameters:
sequence - The Sequence to play
loop - Set to true to loop forever, false to terminate after the end of the sequence

setPaused

public void setPaused(boolean paused)
Sets the paused state. Music may not immediately pause

Parameters:
paused - Set to true to pause the sequencer, false to restart

stop

public void stop()
Stops the sequencer and resets its position to 0
